definitions.definition: Act or instance of running, of moving rapidly using the feet.
examples: I just got back from my morning run .

definitions.definition: Act or instance of hurrying (to or from a place) ( not necessarily on foot ) ; dash or errand , trip .
examples: I need to make a run to the store.

definitions.definition: A pleasure trip.
examples: Let's go for a run in the car.

definitions.definition: Flight , instance or period of fleeing .
Migration of fish .
A group of fish that migrate, or ascend a river for the purpose of spawning.
A literal or figurative path or course for movement relating to:

subdefinitions.definition: A (regular) trip or route .
examples: The bus on the Cherry Street run is always crowded.

subdefinitions.definition: The route taken while running or skiing.
examples: Which run did you do today?

subdefinitions.definition: A single trip down a hill, as in skiing and bobsledding .
The distance sailed by a ship.
examples: a good run ; a run of fifty miles

subdefinitions.definition: A voyage .
examples: a run to China

subdefinitions.definition: A trial .
examples: The data got lost, so I'll have to perform another run of the experiment.

subdefinitions.definition: The execution of a program or model
examples: This morning's run of the SHIPS statistical model gave Hurricane Priscilla a 74% chance of gaining at least 30 knots of intensity in 24 hours, reconfirmed by the HMON and GFS dynamical models.

subdefinitions.definition: A playthrough , or attempted playthrough; a session of play.
examples: This was my first successful run without losing any health.
That NPC bugged out and killed my run .

definitions.definition: Unrestricted use. Only used in have the run of .
examples: He can have the run of the house.

definitions.definition: An enclosure for an animal; a track or path along which something can travel.
examples: He set up a rabbit run .

definitions.definition: A rural landholding for farming , usually for running sheep , and operated by a runholder .
State of being current; currency; popularity.
Something continuous or sequential.

subdefinitions.definition: A continuous period (of time) marked by a trend; a period marked by a continuing trend.
examples: I’m having a run of bad luck.
He went to Las Vegas and spent all his money over a three-day run .

subdefinitions.definition: A series of tries in a game that were successful.
examples: If our team can keep up their strong defense, expect them to make a run in this tournament.

subdefinitions.definition: A production quantity (such as in a factory).
examples: Yesterday we did a run of 12,000 units.
The book’s initial press run will be 5,000 copies.

subdefinitions.definition: The period of showing of a play, film, TV series, etc.
examples: The run of the show lasted two weeks, and we sold out every night.
It is the last week of our French cinema run .

subdefinitions.definition: A period of extended (usually daily ) drug use.
A sequence of cards in a suit in a card game.
A rapid passage in music , especially along a scale .

definitions.definition: A flow of liquid ; a leak .
examples: The constant run of water from the faucet annoys me.
a run of must in wine-making
the first run of sap in a maple orchard

definitions.definition: A small creek or part thereof. ( Compare Southern US branch and New York and New England brook . )
examples: The military campaign near that creek was known as "The battle of Bull Run ".
definitions.label_groups: chiefly eastern North Midland US , especially Ohio , Pennsylvania , West Virginia

definitions.definition: A quick pace , faster than a walk .
examples: He broke into a run .

subdefinitions.definition: A fast gallop .

definitions.definition: A sudden series of demands on a bank or other financial institution, especially characterised by great withdrawals.
examples: Financial insecurity led to a run on the banks, as customers feared for the security of their savings.

definitions.definition: Any sudden large demand for something.
examples: There was a run on Christmas presents.

definitions.definition: Various horizontal dimensions or surfaces

subdefinitions.definition: The top of a step on a staircase , also called a tread , as opposed to the rise .
The horizontal length of a set of stairs
Horizontal dimension of a slope .

definitions.definition: A standard or unexceptional group or category.
examples: He stood out from the usual run of applicants.

definitions.definition: In sports

subdefinitions.definition: A score when a runner touches all bases legally; the act of a runner scoring.
The act of passing from one wicket to another; the point scored for this.
A running play.
The movement communicated to a golf ball by running it.
The distance a ball travels after touching the ground from a stroke.
The distance drilled with a bit , in oil drilling.

definitions.definition: A line of knit stitches that have unravelled , particularly in a nylon stocking .
examples: I have a run in my stocking.

definitions.definition: The stern of the underwater body of a ship from where it begins to curve upward and inward.

The horizontal distance to which a drift may be carried, either by licence of the proprietor of a mine or by the nature of the formation; also, the direction which a vein of ore or other substance takes.
A pair or set of millstones .
One’s gait while running; the way one runs.
examples: I think they only have a weird run because their leg hurts.
